write your numbers and draw a line under. multiply from left to right. if you find it easier, draw arrows for starters!! from 3 to 7, then from 3 to 4, then from 1 to 7, then from 1 to 4.   a) (1)3x(4)7 or 3x7 is 21, write 1, carry 2 over to 4  2   47×13 ------------     1   b) (1)3x4(7) or 3x4 is 12 plus the carried 2 is 14, write down 14.   2    47×13 ------------  141   c) 1(3)x(4)7 or 1x7 is 7, write it under tens place because its actually 10x7 which is 70 but you do not have to write the 0 because its just a place holder.   2    47×13 ------------  141    7(0)   d) 1(3)×4(7) or 1x4 is 4, write down 4.   (2)     47×13 ------------   141 +47(0)     now add them together -------------   611   essencially what we did is 13x7 and 13x40 :) its the same as professors method but i find this "set up" easier idk   every new line is moved by one place       1 1         722×714 ---------------------       2888       722   5054 -------------   515508
